title: How to Make Sweet Potato Soup

steps.headline: Peel sweet potatoes and dice them to about an inch in size for faster cooking.
Peel and rough chop your onion.
Clean and cut up your celery to one inch pieces.
Do the same for your fennel if you have decided you'd like to incorporate it for a slightly more gourmet taste.
Place all vegetable pieces in your large kettle.
steps.description: Add water to about one inch over the vegetables. Bring to a boil and simmer until all vegetables are soft. You can also pre-bake your sweet potatoes before slicing and adding to the pot for this step for easier pureeing later.

steps.headline: Remove from heat.
steps.description: Use stick blender to puree all the vegetables together. If desired, add a pinch of cinnamon, nutmeg, or curry. Don't add the salt until after you have used the chicken or vegetable stock.

steps.headline: Return to heat.
steps.description: Add enough chicken or vegetable stock to thin out the puree to desired soup consistency. Taste your product at this point and add salt if needed and pepper to taste, or another pinch of spice if needed. You may add a splash of heavy cream at this point to give it a creamier appearance. Heat to serving temperature without boiling.

steps.headline: Ladle the soup into bowls or soup cups.
steps.description: Top with a dollop of sour cream if desired, it does add a depth to the soup, and if you have added a bit too much curry or any other spice, it will help to calm the heat a bit.

text: Peel sweet potatoes and dice them to about an inch in size for faster cooking.  Peel and rough chop your onion.  Clean and cut up your celery to one inch pieces.  Do the same for your fennel if you have decided you'd like to incorporate it for a slightly more gourmet taste.  Place all vegetable pieces in your large kettle. Add water to about one inch over the vegetables. Bring to a boil and simmer until all vegetables are soft. You can also pre-bake your sweet potatoes before slicing and adding to the pot for this step for easier pureeing later. Remove from heat. Use stick blender to puree all the vegetables together. If desired, add a pinch of cinnamon, nutmeg, or curry. Don't add the salt until after you have used the chicken or vegetable stock. Return to heat. Add enough chicken or vegetable stock to thin out the puree to desired soup consistency. Taste your product at this point and add salt if needed and pepper to taste, or another pinch of spice if needed. You may add a splash of heavy cream at this point to give it a creamier appearance. Heat to serving temperature without boiling. Ladle the soup into bowls or soup cups. Top with a dollop of sour cream if desired, it does add a depth to the soup, and if you have added a bit too much curry or any other spice, it will help to calm the heat a bit.
